intro: Dichromena hispida, commonly known as the hairy dichromena, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Dichromena hispida is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
